thread.title: Red Devils tennis qualifies 5 for state
thread.title_full: Red Devils tennis qualifies 5 for state

author: For The Courier (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: Red Devils tennis qualifies 5 for state
text: slideshow LITTLE ROCK — The Atkins Red Devils tennis team qualified five for the Class 3A state tournament during the 3A-5 Conference tournament on Tuesday at Burns Park. The Lady Red Devils finished as 3A-5 Conference runners-up to Episcopal Collegiate.Kaylen Martin finished as 3A-5 Conference runner-up in girls singles by defeating Gober of Benton Harmony Grove 6-0,6-0 in her first round and then Mordon of Episcopal Collegiate 6-4, 6-7, 7-5 in the semifinals. She was defeated in the finals by defending 3A State Champion Worsham of Episcopal Collegiate.Corlota Gordea finished third in girls singles, defeating Kyten Tencleve of Paris 6-4, 6-2 in the first round and losing to Worsham of Episcopal 1-6, 1-6 in the semifinals. She defeated Mordon 6-1, 6-1 in the third place match.In girls doubles, Sydney Webb and Payton Harvill finished third by defeating Mooney/Richard of Benton Harmony Grove 6-2, 6-0 in the first round before losing in the semifinals to the defending 3A State Champions Jackson/Tabor 1-6, 2-6. In the third place match, they defeated Diaz/Jay of Paris 6-2, 6-0. Lexie Rehm and Shelby Davis were defeated in their opening round match by Diaz/Jay of Paris.Chris Beard finished third in boys singles and defeated McNahan of Jessieville 6-2,6-0 before losing to eventual conference champion Harrison James of Episcopal 6-1,6-3 in the semi-finals. He defeated Haney of Booneville 4-6, 6-2,(10-6) in the third place match. Bradley Hillis was defeated in the first round by 2nd seeded Anderson of Jessieville 2-6,2-6.In boys doubles, August Moudy and Kelton Brown were defeated by Lawson/Vancleve of Booneville while Ben Brixey and Isaac Ferguson were defeated by Shock/Chen of Episcopal Collegiate.Martin, Webb, Gordea, Harvill and Beard all qualified for the 3A state tournament on Oct. 19-20 at Burns Park in North Little Rock. This is the second consecutive year the Lady Devils have finished as the team runner-up to Episcopal Collegiate.“This year has been a lot of fun,” Atkins head coach Craig Pinion said. “The girls team did not lose a match and the boys had a singles player go undefeated and another only lose one match. They have been a great group of young people to work with and be around. The seniors will be greatly missed.”
